snippet: Israel’s interior minister said Sunday that Günter Grass, a well-known German author, was not welcome in the country because of his controversial poem about the region’s nuclear crisis.
abstract: Israel’s interior minister Eli Yishai says that Gunter Grass, a well-known German author, is not welcome in the country because of his controversial poem about the region’s nuclear crisis that accused Israel of being a threat to world peace.

byline.original: By ETHAN BRONNER and NICHOLAS KULISH
byline.contributor: Ethan Bronner reported from Jerusalem, and Nicholas Kulish from Berlin.

lead_paragraph: Israel’s interior minister said Sunday that Günter Grass, a well-known German author, was not welcome in the country because of his controversial poem about the region’s nuclear crisis.

headline.seo: Israel Bars Günter Grass Over Poem
headline.main: Israel Bars German Laureate Grass Over Poem
headline.print_headline: Israel Bars German Laureate Over Poem
